unittitle.value: <emph render="italic">The Battle of Long Island: A Bird's Eye View</emph> exhibition maps and drawings

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
The collection primarily consists of a series of drawings which were used to design a map of the Battle of Long Island (also known as the Battle of Brooklyn) for a Long Island Historical Society exhibition entitled 
                <emph render="italic">The Battle of Long Island: A Bird's Eye View</emph>, which was held at the Williamsburgh Savings Bank at One Hanson Place, Brooklyn, New York. The exhibition opened in August 1976 as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration. The map was designed by George M. Colbert. An additional map, drawn by Lucy Durand Sikes, is also included in the collection, along with an exhibition pamphlet and poster.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); The Battle of Long Island exhibition maps and drawings, ARC.301, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

The items in this collection were created as a work-for-hire for the Long Island Historical Society (later known as Brooklyn Historical Society) in 1976. The items were transferred from the BHS map collection to the archives in January 2015.
